p: Ben Jemia et al. [ 38] studied the antioxidant activity of the essential oil of Thuja leaves from Tunisia. The results of the DPPH test showed a low activity, with an IC 50 of the order of 25.50 ± 0.57 μg/mL, two times less important than that of the positive control (BHT) (IC 50 = 12.0 ± 0.13 μg/mL). It should be noted that bornyl acetate (31.4%), α-pinene (24.5%), and camphor (20.3%) are the majority constituents of this essential oil.
